item.description:
on facebook: https://www.facebook.com/events/254225387995919/

 

This event could potentially get extremely crowded!! So it's more of a courtesy announcement that if you want to mix/mingle with locals this is the place to do it. If you want to meet other meetup-ers in the group, we'll try to establish a place to congregate but when the volume of the crowd grows there's no guarantee. Please make sure you look at our pictures and introduce yourself.

 

From their info:

If you haven't heard of this global yet unpronounceable phenomenon, Pecha Kucha is a monthly format for sharing ideas, in which presenters are allotted 20 slides and 20 seconds per slide. Put simply: 6 minutes and 40 seconds of adult-style show & tell. It began in Tokyo in 2003, has since spread to over 463 cities worldwide, and first landed in Providence in March of 09.

 

***Doors open at 7:20, presentations start at 8:20, and shmoozing goes down throughout.***

 

There is usually an intermission break between presentation sets. Don't necessarily have to stay the whole time - come and go as you desire. Or even grab new friends and head down the street for a different scene.
item.name: PECHA/KUCHA Providence 3rd Anniversary Party
